prompt.content: For FY2024, calculate the research and development (R&D) expense as a percentage of revenue for Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. (KRX:005930) and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co., Ltd. (NYSE:TSM). Round each percentage to two decimal places. Discuss briefly what these R&D intensity values imply about each companyâ€™s strategic focus.

messages.content: [{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Samsung R&D in FY 2024 = 34,998,142 million KRW."},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Samsung Revenue in FY 2024 = 300,870,903 million KRW."},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"TSMC R&D (NTD) in the FY 2024 = 204,181.8 million NTD."},{"criteria":"TSMC Revenue (NTD) in the FY 2024 = 2,894,307.7 million NTD.","operator":"correctness"},{"criteria":"Calculate R&D as a percentage of revenue for Samsung = 11.6323%","operator":"correctness"},{"criteria":"Calculate R&D as a percentage of revenue for TSMC = 7.0546%","operator":"correctness"},{"criteria":"Round answer to two percentage points = 11.63%","operator":"correctness"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Round answer to two percentage points = 7.05%"},{"criteria":"Determine Samsung has a higher R&D intensity than Samsung","operator":"correctness"},{"criteria":"Provide a reason for Samsung's R&D intensity that includes an explanation that Samsung has a more diverse business model that operates a range of product lines, and thus needs more investment.","operator":"correctness"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Provide a reason for TSMC's lower R&D intensity that includes an explanation that discusses that TSMC has a larger revenue base than Samsung and more concentrated business operations which requires less overall R&D on an R&D to sales basis"}]
